newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany's Waigel confident of Eurofighter deal.
newsitem.headline: Germany's Waigel confident of Eurofighter deal.

text.p: Finance Minister Theo Waigel said on Saturday he was not far from an agreement with Defence Minister Volker Ruehe over how to finance Germany's commitment to the Eurofighter project.

Waigel told a local meeting of his Christian Social Union party in the town of Gunzhausen that the positions of both sides were close together. He said withdrawing from the project would cause "enormous damage" for Germany.

Germany's Eurofighter partners are fretting at the delay to a firm order by Bonn. The firms making the jet include DASA, a unit of Daimler-Benz AG, British Aerospace, Alenia of Italy and state-owned CASA of Spain.

Bonn is expected to take 180 Eurofighters for about 23 billion marks. Waigel said talks between the German government and DASA about how to finance the company's part in the project were also progressing well.

Government sources have said Bonn is in talks with DASA with the aim of getting the aircraft manufacturer to pay back state aid for another project early so that the money can be used to help finance the Eurofighter.
Waigel met Ruehe on Thursday to discuss the 1988 defence budget but said afterwards more talks were needed.
